;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
;; @MPP (Morrowind Patch Project) [TES Morrowind Community, ThePal, Baldurdash, and quorn]

;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
;;Suggest MPP if not using it
;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

[Note]
 !! You are not running the highly recommended Morrowind Patch Project (MPP). It fixes quest bugs, spelling and grammar, corrects subtitles and mesh and texture errors; amongst other fixes. Whilst Bethesda's own patches fixed a couple of dozen bugs the MPP fixes hundreds.
 !! There are a number of versions available:
 !!  1.6.5 beta-BTB edit - A slightly edited version of quorn's 1.6.5 beta release. It removes several bugs from the 1.6.5 beta release.
 !!             - This is the recommended version.
 !!             - http://btb2.free.fr/morrowind.html
 !!  1.6.5 beta - A beta version, by quorn, released to fix the bugs reported in the 1.6.4 release.
 !!             -  http://mw.modhistory.com/download-84-7127
 !!  1.6.4 - The last official release by quorn. Enhances Thepal's original patch (1.6.3b) with more unaddressed bug fixes.
 !!             - http://mw.modhistory.com/download-50-7319
 !! Ref: http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Tes3Mod:Morrowind_Patch_Project
[ALL Morrowind.esm
     Tribunal.esm
     Bloodmoon.esm
     [NOT [ANY Morrowind Patch v1.6.4.esm
               Morrowind Patch v1.6.5-BETA.esm
               Morrowind Patch 1.6.5 Beta (BTB Edit).esm
               Morrowind Rebirth <VER> - Morrowind Patch *.esm]]]

[Note]
 !! You are not running the highly recommended Morrowind Patch Project (MPP). It fixes quest bugs, spelling and grammar, corrects subtitles and mesh and texture errors; amongst other fixes. Whilst Bethesda's own patches fixed a couple of dozen bugs the MPP fixes hundreds.
 !! As you are running Morrowind without the expansions you should download and install v1.2.2b
 !! http://www.paulcarr.com.au/elderscrolls/patch/
[ALL Morrowind.esm
     [NOT Tribunal.esm]
     [NOT Bloodmoon.esm]
     [NOT Morrowind Patch v1.2.2.esm]]

;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
;;General notes section
;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

[Note]
 ! Morrowind Patch v1.2.2.esm is old and should only be run by people who do not have the expansions. Since you have Tribunal and Bloodmoon, it is highly recommended that you upgrade to the MPP.
 ! There are a number of versions available:
 !  1.6.5 beta-BTB edit - A slightly edited version of quorn's 1.6.5 beta release. It removes several bugs from the 1.6.5 beta release.
 !             - This is the recommended version.
 !             - http://btb2.free.fr/morrowind.html
 !  1.6.5 beta - A beta version, by quorn, released to fix the bugs reported in the 1.6.4 release.
 !             -  http://mw.modhistory.com/download-84-7127
 !  1.6.4 - The last official release by quorn. Enhances Thepal's original patch (1.6.3b) with more unaddressed bug fixes.
 !             - http://mw.modhistory.com/download-50-7319
 ! Ref: http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Tes3Mod:Morrowind_Patch_Project

[Order]
Morrowind.esm
Morrowind Patch v1.2.2.esm

[Note]
 ! You have an older version of the MPP (Morrowind Patch Project) installed.
 ! There are a number of versions available:
 !  1.6.5 beta-BTB edit - A slightly edited version of quorn's 1.6.5 beta release. It removes several bugs from the 1.6.5 beta release.
 !             - This is the recommended version.
 !             - http://btb2.free.fr/morrowind.html
 !  1.6.5 beta - A beta version, by quorn, released to fix the bugs reported in the 1.6.4 release.
 !             -  http://mw.modhistory.com/download-84-7127
 !  1.6.4 - The last official release by quorn. Enhances Thepal's original patch (1.6.3b) with more unaddressed bug fixes.
 !             - http://mw.modhistory.com/download-50-7319
 ! Ref: http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Tes3Mod:Morrowind_Patch_Project
Morrowind Patch v1.6.2.esm

[Conflict]
 The MPP does something similar to Almalexia Undialog [SeekerVI].
 "abyssmal terror" reports: the MPP adds nolore to the unfiltered topics, Almalexia Undialog filters those dialog to temple members, so it's removed from more NPCs. Use the Almalexia Undialog to get rid of the tribunal almalexia dialog from most NPCs.
 (Ref: http://www.bethsoft.com/bgsforums/index.php?showtopic=794715&st=80&p=12924494&;entry12924494 )
[ANY Morrowind Patch v1.6.4.esm
     Morrowind Patch v1.6.5-BETA.esm
     Morrowind Patch 1.6.5 Beta (BTB Edit).esm
     Morrowind Rebirth <VER> - Morrowind Patch *.esm]
Almalexia_undialog.esp

[Conflict]
 The MPP obsoletes Bloodmoon Ammo Fix v1.0609 [Srikandi].
 "abyssmal terror" reports: both fixes the single counts of ammo, but in different ways. Srikandi adds more ammo in general in varying stacks, while the MPP adds less ammo in general, but in stacks of 20 like in the rest of containers. both modify the same lists, and Srikandi's fix can be used over the MPP.
 (Ref: http://www.bethsoft.com/bgsforums/index.php?showtopic=794715&st=80&p=12924494&;entry12924494 )
[ANY Morrowind Patch v1.6.4.esm
     Morrowind Patch v1.6.5-BETA.esm
     Morrowind Patch 1.6.5 Beta (BTB Edit).esm
     Morrowind Rebirth <VER> - Morrowind Patch *.esm]

 (Ref: "Vampire Realism II Manual/Installation.htm")
Vampire Realism II - TB Add-On.esp
[ALL Vampire Realism II.esp
     Tribunal.esm]

[Patch]
 (Ref: "Vampire Realism II Manual/Installation.htm")
Vampire Realism II - BM Add-On.esp
[ALL Vampire Realism II.esp
     Bloodmoon.esm]

[Patch]
 "Vampire Realism II - BL Patch.esp" is the patch file for Bloodlines, which is a quest mod by Carnithus, NOT a misspelling of "Bloodmoon", as many seem to think. It fixes a small conflict between Vampire Realism and Bloodlines to do with Vampire Realism's changes to sun damage and Bloodlines' sun damage-reducing Nasgiel armor. If you use Bloodlines you must use this patch file.
 (Ref: "Vampire Realism II Manual/Installation.htm")
Vampire Realism II - BL Patch.esp
[ALL Vampire Realism II.esp
     [ANY Blood Lines I_BloodMoon.esp
	  Blood Lines I_Tribunal.esp]]

[Patch]
 "Vampire Realism II - VE Patch.esp" is the patch file for Vampire Embrace. It fixes a small conflict between Vampire Realism and Vampire Embrace that has to do with VR's staking system and VE's combat-feeding system. It also makes VR's hunger recognize VE feeding, both dialogue and combat. If you use Vampire Embrace you must use this patch file.
 (Ref: "Vampire Realism II Manual/Installation.htm")
Vampire Realism II - VE Patch.esp
[ALL Vampire Realism II.esp
     Vampire_Embrace.esp]

;;Readme_VH.htm - "change the mod loading order by putting Bloodlines below Vampire Embrace and Vampiric Hunger - BL.esp below Bloodlines" and "The Vampiric Hunger Bloodlines patch is compatible with Vampire Realism's but Vampiric Hunger's patch must be the newer"

[Conflict]
 Choose only one plugin:
  Vampiric Hunger MGE Addon for MGE 1.11+.esp - If you have Morrowind Graphics Extender (MGE) v1.11 or a later version.
  Vampiric Hunger MGE Addon for MGE 1.10f-.esp - If you have Morrowind Graphics Extender (MGE) v1.10f or a previous version.
  Vampiric Hunger Bloodlust Effect.esp - This is an old version and should not be used.
  Vampiric Hunger UI (MGE XE).esp - If you have Morrowind Graphics Extender XE (MGE XE) v0.9.0 or later
 (Ref: Readme_VH.htm)

[Note]
 !! To make Zennorious' "Vampiric Hunger" compatible with Jaxalot's "Vampire Realism" you must disable one of the mods' hunger and scripted sun damage feature with their configuration menu.
 !! (Ref: Readme_VH.htm)
[ALL Vampiric Hunger Base.esp
     Vampire Realism II.esp]

;;Dragon32: Zennorius gives the e.g. of Werewolf Forget. Checked a bunch of other werewolf mods for this variable check
[Conflict]
 These mods check the "PCKnownWerewolf" variable (when this variable is 1 every NPC will attack you when they see you). 'Vampiric Hunger Extended.esp' uses this variable to make the nearby NPCs attack you when you drink blood or embrace in front of others.
 This conflict can cause problems so you should disable the Crowd Attack in Vampiric Hunger Extended's configuration menu.
 (Ref: Readme_VH.htm)
Vampiric Hunger Extended.esp
[ANY WW Forget II.esp
     Werewolf reequip.esp
     Sg_werewolfclans.esp
     Werewolfrealism-moononly.esp
     Werewolfrealism-moononly_changeatwill.esp
     Were-better.esp]

[Note]
 This is a demonstration plugin and not intended for full play
 (Ref: Vampiric_Hunger_III-1450.zip\VH Clan Example.zip\VH Clan Example_Readme.txt)
VH Clan Example.esp

[Requires]
 (Ref: Vampiric_Hunger_III-1450.zip\VH Clan Example.zip\VH Clan Example_Readme.txt)
VH Clan Example.esp
[ALL Vampiric Hunger Base.esp
     Vampire_Embrace.esp]

 ! Version 1.2 of Vampiric Hunger III is compatible with GCD and no longer requires the "GCD_VH_patch2.esp" patch.

     [SIZE 288521 Vampiric Hunger Base.esp]]

;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
;; @Vurt's Leafy West Gash I & II [Vurt]

[Note]
 ! "Vurt's Leafy West Gash" is available in two versions, the original "Vurt's Leafy West Gash" and "Vurt's Leafy West Gash II". The latter has less colourful trees than the original mod.
 ! Both mods use the same name for their plugin: Vurt's Leafy West Gash.esp.
 ! The plugin is required for "Vurt's Leafy West Gash II" as it gives "better placement and less clipping, the .esp also enables some additional, rare trees."
 ! Version 2.0 and above of "Vurt's Leafy West Gash" is pluginless and so the plugin is not needed.
 ! You should check to see if you need this plugin loaded.
 ! Vurt's Leafy West Gash - http://planetelderscrolls.gamespy.com/View.php?view=Mods.Detail&id=8334
 ! Vurt's Leafy West Gash II - http://planetelderscrolls.gamespy.com/View.php?view=Mods.Detail&id=9037
Vurt's Leafy West Gash.esp

 The Weapon Fix plugin does not include body parts for Leia's Double Wield Mod. This means the defensive weapons will not be visible in game. To fix this you will need to run TESTool's Merge Objects function and enable the Merged_Objects.esp.
 (Ref: Dragon32, examined the plugins)

     weaponFix177.esp
     [NOT Merged_Objects.esp]]

;; If you play with a female char, you should use the KISS-patch

;; kiss; after that, you won't need the patch any further.

 Danjb and others have created "Wizards' Islands Super Patch" which offers a version where "Both islands have been moved north to make the mod compatible with Tamriel Rebuilt." This appears to work with Silgrad Tower as well.
 http://planetelderscrolls.gamespy.com/View.php?view=Mods.Detail&id=9075

;;Dragon32: Some notes on addons for Wizards Islands:

;;Wizards Islands Walkthrough [Robin Irvin]
[Note]
 !! This plugin contains evil GMSTs.
 !! (What the hell is a GMST? http://www.mwmythicmods.com/argent/tech/gmst.html )
[SIZE 43206 WI Walkthru.esp]

;; @Wrye Patches [Wrye]
; (Ref: http://wrye.ufrealms.net/Wrye Patches.html )

[Requires]
 All of the Wrye Patches require both Tribunal and Bloodmoon be installed.
 (Ref: http://wrye.ufrealms.net/Wrye Patches.html )
[ANY Wrye Patches A.esp
     Wrye Patches A1.esp
     Wrye Patches B.esp
     Wrye Patches C.esp
     Wrye Patches C1.esp
     Wrye Patches G.esp
     Wrye Patches M.esp
     Wrye Patches M1.esp
     Wrye Patches W.esp]
[ALL Tribunal.esm
     Bloodmoon.esm]

[Conflict]
 The "A" version is for vanilla Morrowind, the "A1" version depends on Avenger's female armor.
 (Ref: http://wrye.ufrealms.net/Wrye%20Patches.html#AlternateVersions )
Wrye Patches A.esp
Wrye Patches A1.esp

[Conflict]
 According to Wrye's documentation, you should not load Avenger's female armor plugins along with the A1 patch.
 (Ref: http://wrye.ufrealms.net/Wrye%20Patches.html#AlternateVersions )
Wrye Patches A1.esp
[ANY AV_female_armor.esp
     AV_fem_armor_Trib.esp]

[Conflict]
 According to Wrye's documentation, you should not load Avenger's female shirts/robes or Prosey Female Pants plugins along with the C1 patch.
 (Ref: http://wrye.ufrealms.net/Wrye%20Patches.html#AlternateVersions )
Wrye Patches C1.esp
[ANY AV_fem_shirts.esp
     AV_fem_robes.esp
     AV_fem_robes_BM.esp
     AV_fem_robes_Trib.esp
     Prosey female pants replace.esp]

[Conflict]
 According to Wrye's documentation, you should not load Daduke's key replacer plugin along with the M1 patch.
 (Ref: http://wrye.ufrealms.net/Wrye%20Patches.html#AlternateVersions )
Wrye Patches M1.esp
Key Replacer Trib & BM.esp

[Requires]
 "Wrye Patches A1.esp" requires "LeFemmArmor.esp" or any compilation that includes it.
Wrye Patches A1.esp
[ANY LeFemmArmor.esp
     OfficialMods_v5.esp
     Clean Official Plugins v1.1.esp
     super_adventurers302.esp
     Taddeus'BalancedArmors.esp
     Taddeus'BalancedArmors_Rotate.esp]

[Conflict]
 The "C" version is for vanilla Morrowind, the "C1" version depends on Avenger's female shirts/robes, and Prosey's female pants.
 (Ref: http://wrye.ufrealms.net/Wrye%20Patches.html#AlternateVersions )
Wrye Patches C.esp
Wrye Patches C1.esp

[Conflict]
 The "M" version is for vanilla Morrowind, the "M1" version depends on Daduke's Key Replacer.
 (Ref: http://wrye.ufrealms.net/Wrye%20Patches.html#AlternateVersions )
Wrye Patches M.esp
Wrye Patches M1.esp

[Note]
 "Wrye Patches M.esp" incorrectly defines the NIF model for object "misc_dwrv_ark_key00" (key to Arkngthand) as "dd\misc_dwrv_Ark_key00.nif". It should be: "m\misc_dwrv_Ark_key00.nif". This model is supposed to be used for the version "Wrye Patches M1.esp", but apparently got used in "Wrye Patches M.esp" by mistake. So you may run across this as a missing or incorrect model in your game. It is easy to correct the name of the model in the Construction Set should you encounter this problem.
[SIZE 63823 Wrye Patches M.esp]

 "DO NOT use both the companion ESPs, only one."
 "X-jiitCompanionsTB.esp" should be used if you only have Tribunal.
 "X-jiitCompanionsBM.esp" should be used if you only have Bloodmoon.
 If you have both expansion, just pick one of the two.
 (Ref: "X-jiit Readme.txt")

;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
;; @The Zone [Tarazaurus Rex]

[Requires]
 (Ref: The Zone readme.txt)
The Zone (Tribunal).esp
Tribunal.esm

[Note]
 "The Zone" replaces two of the stock daedric ruin textures:
  Tx_Daed_metal_02.dds
  Tx_Daed_wall_03.dds
 This will interfere with any daedric texture replacers you are using and cause problems with MGE rendering the Daedric ruins as distant statics. It is recommended that you delete these two texture files.
The Zone (Tribunal).esp
